TopicTitle: Climate Change and its affect on Kerbals.

Articles.Content: Sea level rise due to climate change on Kerbin has caused this.

The cost of air conditioning has risen due to overwhelming demand forcing the space program to remove the AC units and get rid of all the windows!

Hmm... If we could find out how that works, the modding community could mod transparent windows to the KSC! I've seen the "sea level rise" in danny videos, but not the window thing...

Now we have to find out everything we can about how that part works! This bug could be the foundation of a pretty cool mod!

- - - Updated - - -

ninja'd! BUT STILL!

- - - Updated - - -

Not just the VAB, but all the windows in every building...

Bad news guys.

The flooding got so severe that they had to relocate the entire KSC to space!

Doesn't Kerbin burst into flames for a brief moment after leaving the VAB? Honestly at this point i'm sure that the universe simply can't handle all the Kerbal's shenanigans. Seriously, what kind of climate bursts into flames at mere seconds on end? Now these rockets must output some SERIOUS pollution.

I know, right? Recently the atmosphere has been changing so much, as often as once every month or two since April. And one development in particular was introduced to the space program at the exact same time that the climate change in our atmosphere started! It's too much to be just a coincidence:

[img]http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/3/33/ISRU_Converter.png[/img]

Yes, global warming is caused by all the drilling for [s]oil[/s] I mean ore. We can't keep taking fossil fuels out of the ground! Recently, runaway global warming has led to buildup of greenhouse gases in the upper atmosphere to unprecedented levels, and many brave Kerbals lost their lives on re-entry that is suddenly much more dangerous than the atmosphere that existed when their ships were launched!

[quote name='sdj64']I Yes, global warming is caused by all the drilling for [s]oil[/s] I mean ore. We can't keep taking fossil fuels out of the ground!![/QUOTE]

No, it's the radiators. Until radiators appeared, Kerbin had a stable climate. But you know what radiators do, right? Their entire purpose in life is to pump heat into the surrounding environment. And the manufacturers proudly proclaim how much heat they can put into the air. So the last few months, thousands of new radiators have been built and are now in operation, and Kerbin's temperature has spiked as a direct result.
Might it be time to institute a cap and trade regime for ore usage? Folks who just like to drive their rovers and boats around on Kerbin can sell their credits to those who want to leave the surface.

[quote name='FancyMouse']And VAB has semipermeable membrane walls[/QUOTE]
We were just talking about that in Biology!!!

Its not climate change, all the insane rocket launches have compacted the ground around the KSC down until its under sea level.... Kerbal scientist have already developed a plan to place another KSC on the opposite side in a hope to pop it back up using ridiculous launches.
